item.title: China imposes sanctions on US officials
item.description: The sanctions are in response to recent US sanctions on Chinese officials in Hong Kong.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: 2020 Games begin as Naomi Osaka lights Olympic flame in poignant ceremony
item.description: The Tokyo 2020 Games are officially under way as Naomi Osaka lights the Olympic flame in a poignant opening ceremony.

item.title: Olympics: Munich victims honoured for first time at opening ceremony
item.description: Nearly 50 years after 11 Israeli athletes were killed, a moment's silence is marked in Tokyo.

item.title: Jovenel Moïse: Unrest mars funeral of assassinated Haitian leader
item.description: Gunshots and tear gas punctuate the funeral of former Haitian President Jovenel Moïse.

item.title: Jeff Bezos and Sir Richard Branson not yet astronauts, US says
item.description: The US government has tightened rules on which space-goers can claim their astronaut wings.

item.title: US fires: Inside a US fire truck driving through a wildfire
item.description: As burning ash pelts their vehicle, video shows firefighters in California drive through the flames.

item.title: Angelina Jolie wins appeal to remove judge from Brad Pitt divorce case
item.description: The ruling is a victory for Angelina Jolie, who is locked in a custody battle with Brad Pitt.

item.title: Las Vegas murder case cracked with smallest ever amount of DNA
item.description: Just 15 cells' worth of DNA was used to track down the man suspected of killing a US girl in 1989.

item.title: India monsoon: 110 dead after heavy rainfall in Maharashtra
item.description: Rescuers are racing to evacuate survivors but many are feared missing in the state of Maharashtra.

item.title: Man rescued in Alaska after week-long bear attack ordeal
item.description: US Coast Guard officials spotted an SOS sign on a remote shack where the man had been staying.

item.title: German TV apologises for smearing mud on clothes at flood site
item.description: A video showed Susanna Ohlen rubbing herself with dirt before broadcasting from a flood-hit town.

item.title: MLB's Cleveland Indians drop controversial name
item.description: After decades of criticism from Native American groups, the Cleveland Indians have a new name.

item.title: Coronavirus: Was US money used to fund risky research in China?
item.description: What's the row about virus research in China between a prominent Republican and Dr Anthony Fauci?

item.title: Trading sex for cosmetic surgery in Mexico's narco capital
item.description: The influence of narcos has caused many women to undergo cosmetic surgery in Mexico's Sinaloa state.

item.title: Sundarbans: Why the world’s largest mangrove forest is sinking
item.description: The low-lying islands are being battered by violent storms, rising sea levels, and melting ice from the Himalayas.

item.title: The cost of hosting the Olympics
item.description: Holding the world's biggest sporting event comes with a hefty price tag

item.title: Ethiopia Tigray crisis: New front opens as aid fears grow
item.description: A bloody eight-month battle for control of the Tigray region spills over into neighbouring Afar.

item.title: AI advance could transform battle against disease
item.description: A program has been used to predict the structures of nearly every protein in the human body.

item.title: Tips from the Netherlands on how to build a nation of cyclists
item.description: Some tips from the Dutch Cycling Embassy on how to make bikes the easiest and safest way to travel.

item.title: DRC volcano: Reuniting children with families after the eruption
item.description: Children are still separated from parents, two months after a volcano erupted near Goma in DR Congo.

item.title: The refugee athlete who lost his mum to Covid
item.description: Abdullah Sediqi, 24, is competing at the Tokyo Games in her honour.

item.title: Tusker Rock's shipwrecks graveyard captured in art project
item.description: Photographer Peter Britton wants his project to stand as a legacy to those lost to Tusker Rock.

item.title: The 12-year-old becoming Tokyo's youngest Olympian
item.description: Hend Zaza from Syria reveals her inspiration for getting into table tennis at such a young age.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Is the USA 'Dream Team' era coming to an end?
item.description: Team USA's men's and women's basketball teams have had difficult preparations for the Olympics, so could Tokyo 2020 see an end to their domination?

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: US gymnast Simone Biles gets her own goat emoji
item.description: What started as a light-hearted response to her "haters" is now an official Simone Biles emoji.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Day-by-day guide to the key events, big stars and British medal hopes
item.description: Want to know what's happening when in Tokyo? Check out our comprehensive guide to all the action in Japan.

item.title: John Coates: Australian Olympic boss in awkward 'mansplaining' row
item.description: In an awkward exchange, John Coates ordered politician Annastacia Palaszczuk to attend the Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Ten global stars to watch out for at the Games
item.description: From Simone Biles to Bruce Springsteen’s daughter Jessica - who are the athletes to follow at the Tokyo Olympics?

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Japanese artists reimagine countries as anime samurai
item.description: The creators have used the flags of competing nations as inspiration to design Japanese warriors.

item.title: 2032 Games: Brisbane confirmed as Olympic and Paralympic host
item.description: Brisbane is confirmed as the host of the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games after approval at an IOC meeting in Tokyo
